page.title: 07Keswick's Century Theatre
page.content: The Century Theatre was built in 1950 in Yorkshire.It was designed to travel from place to place giving a performance where ever it stopped.It travelled around Lancashire before it moved further afield and came to travel around Cumbria.The Century Theatre stopped in Keswick in 1960 because it is a very attractive place.The Century Theatre doesn't get much support from locals but it does from tourists.It isn't a very profitable theatre but the chairman thinks it would be if it was a fixed theatre and if the admission charge was more.There is talk about a new theatre being built on the site of the derelict station but it wouldn't be a very good place because hardly anyone would see it.The theatre is made from metal and alloy.It seats 225 people and has 4 fire exits.
